questions.question: What does the PR interval represent in an ECG?
options: Time from atrial depolarization to ventricular depolarization

questions.question: What is the primary cause of the T wave on an ECG?
Which ECG interval is used to calculate heart rate?
What is the approximate normal duration of the QRS complex in a large dog?
What abnormality is indicated by ST segment elevation?
Which limb lead measures voltage between the left forelimb and the right forelimb?
What is the main feature of ventricular tachycardia on an ECG?
options: Irregularly spaced QRS complexes with a slow ventricular rate
Rapid QRS complexes without preceding P waves
Normal QRS complexes with prolonged PR intervals

questions.question: What is a common cause of low-amplitude QRS complexes on an ECG?
What is Einthoven's triangle?
options: A representation of ventricular conduction pathways
The relationship between standard limb leads in ECG
A method for measuring heart rate

questions.question: In atrial fibrillation, what is the characteristic ECG finding?
options: P waves followed by irregularly spaced QRS complexes
No distinct P waves and irregular RR intervals
Regularly spaced QRS complexes with prolonged PR intervals

questions.question: What is the typical atrial rate in sinus tachycardia?
What feature distinguishes first-degree AV block?
options: Prolonged PR interval with regular QRS complexes
Sporadic QRS complexes without preceding P waves
Complete dissociation of P waves and QRS complexes

questions.question: What does a prolonged QT interval suggest?
Which condition may produce a negative QRS complex in lead I?
What is the standard calibration for voltage in an ECG?
Which lead is most commonly used for ECG interpretation in small animals?
What arrhythmia involves atrial depolarization at rates exceeding 300 bpm?
What characterizes third-degree AV block?
options: Prolonged PR interval with regular QRS complexes
Sporadic QRS complexes with missing P waves
Complete dissociation between P waves and QRS complexes

questions.question: What condition is diagnosed with frequent premature QRS complexes without preceding P waves?
What is the significance of the QT interval?
options: Time for atrial depolarization and contraction
Time for ventricular depolarization and repolarization
Time between atrial and ventricular depolarization
